alert.note: Alert for De Witt; Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 9:32PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern DeWitt and southern Lavaca Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 931 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Yoakum to near Cuero. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cuero, Yoakum, Hallettsville, Shiner, Thomaston, Ezzell, Speaks, Koerth, Edgar, Terryville, Mont, Sweet Home, Arneckville, Mount Olive, Concrete, and Hope. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
